wikipedia_page.main:
John Edmund Swan (1877 – 9 Feb 1956) was a Labour Party politician in England.
Swan was born in Dipton, County Durham.  He became a coal miner, and was later elected as checkweighman, also becoming active in the Durham Miners' Association (DMA).He was elected at the 1918 general election as Member of Parliament (MP) for Barnard Castle in County Durham, but lost his seat at the 1922 election to the Conservative Party candidate, John Edwin Rogerson.Out of Parliament, Swan devoted his time to the DMA, and he was elected as its general secretary in 1935, serving until 1945.  He also remained active in the Labour Party, serving on its National Executive Committee from 1932 until 1941, and on both the Annfield Plain Urban District Council, and the Lanchester Board of Guardians.In his spare time, Swan wrote the novels The Mad Miner and People of the Night, and the play, On the Minimum.

response: *John Swan (engineer) (1787–1869), pioneer of the screw propeller and inventor of the self-acting chain messenger
*John Swan (British politician) (1877–1956), British Labour Party politician
*John Swan (priest), Anglican Anglican; Archdeacon of Lilley and of Brisbane
*John Swan (born 1952), Scottish-Australian singer, also known as Swanee
*John Swan (Neighbours), fictional character in Australian soap opera Neighbours
